nodes.description: 布什总统最初报告Zinni和谈取得进展
nodes.support_text: Secretary of State Colin Powell said that the US envoy, General Anthony Zinni would remain in the region ready for further talks.
By Paul Reynolds BBC Washington correspondent US President George W Bush has condemned the bomb attack in Netanya

nodes.description: 布什强烈谴责袭击并要求阿拉法特制止
nodes.support_text: I condemn it in the most strongest of terms. I call upon Mr Arafat and the Palestinian Authority to do everything in their power to stop the terrorist killing

nodes.description: 鲍威尔建议阿拉法特向民众传达反恐信息
nodes.support_text: Mr Arafat should broadcast to his people, he said, and tell them they were destroying their own vision for a Palestinian state living side by side with Israel

nodes.description: 美国担忧袭击导致和平进程停滞
nodes.support_text: The American fear is that the bombing will derail what is left of the Zinni mission and drive Israel towards a policy of reoccupying the Palestinian territories

nodes.description: 布什对局势恶化表示绝望，原计划受挫
nodes.support_text: Washington's plans of recent days are in tatters and it is scrambling to put something back together

edges.support_text: Secretary of State Colin Powell said that the US envoy, General Anthony Zinni would remain in the region ready for further talks
By Paul Reynolds BBC Washington correspondent US President George W Bush has condemned the bomb attack in Netanya
I condemn it in the most strongest of terms. I call upon Mr Arafat and the Palestinian Authority to do everything in their power to stop the terrorist killing
Mr Arafat should broadcast to his people, he said, and tell them they were destroying their own vision for a Palestinian state living side by side with Israel
Washington's plans of recent days are in tatters and it is scrambling to put something back together
